etymology.description: 八 ‘to divide’ + 牛 ‘cow’: to cut a cow into two halves.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of splitting (八) with a cow (牛) to picture an animal being divided into two equal parts, highlighting the notion of a half. The meaning generalized from a concrete butchering image to the abstract concept of “half.”

examples.chinese: 我们各付一半(我們各付一半)。
把苹果切成两半(把蘋果切成兩半)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ píngguǒ qiē chéng liǎng bàn.
examples.english: Cut the apple into two halves.

examples.chinese: 半小时后见(半小時後見)。
examples.english: See you in half an hour.
